did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Lynn Saville (1950-) is a New York City-based photographer specializing in nocturnal photography. The collection dates from 1972 to 2005 and consists of 205 photographs of nighttime scenes in New York City, Paris, North Carolina, and elsewhere, taken by Lynn Saville. The collection also includes 30 portraits of artists and other individuals. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Lynn Saville Photographs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2002 and 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions 2002-0066, 2002-0067, 2002-0205, 2002-0318, and accessions 2005-0013, 2005-0056, 2005-0083, were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lynn Saville is a photographer based in New York City. She was born in Durham, North Carolina in 1950 and received a B.A. from Duke University in 1971 and an M.F.A. from the Pratt Institute in 1976. Her photographs are held in the Denver Art Museum, the Brooklyn Museum of Art, Oxford University's Bodleian Library, the New York Public Library, and many other museums and libraries.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Lynn Saville Photographs consist of 235 prints dating from 1972 to 2005. The collection contains gelatin silver black and white prints, color prints, and a small number of digital prints; the prints range in size from 11x14 to 20x24. Saville's photographs include 30 portraits of poets, photographers, family members, friends, and prominent women such as Barbara Jordan, Adrienne Rich and Bella Abzug. Her more recent work is primarily nocturnal photography. The collection's primary focus is Saville's 205 photographs of nighttime scenes in the United States and Europe, particularly in New York City (Brooklyn in particular) and Paris. Other locations include Los Angeles, North Carolina, Vermont, Paris, Rome, and Venice.

The collection is divided into the Portraits Series and the Nocturnal Photography Series. Selected images are also available online as part of a digital exhibit. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

unittitle.label: Collection
unittitle.extref: Night Vision: Photographs of William Gedney and Lynn Saville [Online exhibit]

archref.repository: Rare Book, Manuscripts and Special Collections Library, Duke University

scopecontent.p: Thirty 11x14 gelatin silver prints portraying poets, photographers, women in politics, family members, and friends. The series includes one platinum print portrait of Saville taken by Lois Conner. Captions are taken from the prints.

Ed Malinowski, artist and friend in Vermont, 1974
Nocturnal Photography Series, 1973-2005 and undated, bulk 1994-2005

scopecontent.p: The series contains 205 16x20 and 20x24 prints. There are color photographs, gelatin silver, and a few Iris prints (digital prints). Matted prints are located at the end of the series. Approximately 75 prints show scenes from New York City, especially Brooklyn. There are also numerous images shot in Paris. Other locations include Rome, Venice, North Carolina, Vermont, Los Angeles, and New York State. Captions are taken from the prints, with information added in some cases.
